1:
Text: The Studdogs:  The band's music contains elements of punk, blues rock, garage rock, and noise rock.
Triplets:<The Studdogs
3:
--------------------
Text: The Studdogs:  They released a lot of material, particularly the full-length album, "The Gospel According to the Studdogs" and the 7" vinyl 3-song EP, and gained local and national notoriety.
Triplets:<The Studdogs
4:
--------------------
Text: The Studdogs:  They were featured in several national music magazines, including Magnet and Amplifier.
Triplets:<The Studdogs
5:
--------------------
Text: The Studdogs:  Comparisons were made to the Stooges, Dead Boys, and it was said they sounded "like absolute victory by way of slurring, Rolling Stones-y garage rock from nowhere in particular."
Triplets:<The Studdogs
6:
--------------------
Text: The Studdogs:  Their drunken, abrasive live shows often ended with someone bleeding or being thrown out of the venue.
Triplets:<The Studdogs

8:
--------------------
Text: The Studdogs:  The band was signed by Orange Recordings in Los Angeles and toured all over the country, sharing bills with the Demolition Doll Rods, Bob Log III, The Fleshtones, and Immortal Lee County Killers and a one-time show with the Suicide Girls Burlesque Tour in Orlando.
Triplets:<The Studdogs
